job_tasks.phrase: help develop our foundational model for video generation based on large video data-sets.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase directly refers to the development of a core model, which falls under the definition of model development and fine-tuning.

job_tasks.phrase: conducting cutting edge research, pushing the boundaries and going beyond existing SOTA solutions.
job_tasks.justification: This describes the research and advancement of model capabilities, aligning with the 'research and experimentation with new modeling techniques' aspect of Model Development & Fine-Tuning.

job_tasks.phrase: Reviewing specialised literature on text to video / video synthesis.
job_tasks.justification: Reviewing literature is a precursor to model development and research, fitting within the broader scope of staying current with techniques for model creation.

job_tasks.phrase: Designing the requirements, project scoping and owning the roadmap in your area.
job_tasks.justification: This involves defining project scope and strategy, which aligns with understanding business needs and translating them into technical requirements.

job_tasks.phrase: Managing the progress of the Large Video Model project and making sure that it is in line with our vision.
job_tasks.justification: This task involves aligning technical progress with the overall vision, which is a key aspect of business understanding and strategic alignment.

job_tasks.phrase: Building libraries to accelerate our iteration speed during development (abstracting common functionality, automating tests sweeps, visualising results etc.).
job_tasks.justification: This describes the creation of software components to aid the development process, fitting the definition of software development and integration.

job_tasks.phrase: Developing production quality software, our teams work "full stack" with the ability to deliver direct to product and impact the world.
job_tasks.justification: This explicitly mentions developing production-quality software and working full-stack, which are core software development tasks.

job_tasks.phrase: Taking ownership of the full ML lifecycle from concept, development, testing, validation to deployment.
job_tasks.justification: This encompasses the entire ML lifecycle, including deployment and validation, which aligns with MLOps principles.

job_tasks.phrase: Adapting off-the-shelf solutions for the purposes of our product.
job_tasks.justification: This involves modifying existing models or solutions for a specific product, which is a form of model adaptation and development.

job_tasks.phrase: Optimising for deployment - turning prototypes into working solutions.
job_tasks.justification: This task focuses on the transition from prototype to a deployable solution, which is a key aspect of MLOps and operationalizing models.

soft_skills.phrase: You will be someone who loves to code and build working systems.
soft_skills.justification: This highlights a passion for building and creating, suggesting an innovative and ownership-driven mindset.

soft_skills.phrase: You are used to working in a fast-paced start-up environment.
soft_skills.justification: Adaptability to a fast-paced environment is a key aspect of learning and adaptability.

soft_skills.phrase: You will join a group of more than 40 Engineers in the R&D department and will have the opportunity to collaborate with multiple research teams across diverse areas
soft_skills.justification: This explicitly mentions collaboration with multiple teams, indicating a need for strong communication and collaboration skills.

soft_skills.phrase: Designing the requirements, project scoping and owning the roadmap in your area.
soft_skills.justification: Owning the roadmap and scoping projects demonstrates initiative and ownership.

soft_skills.phrase: Managing the progress of the Large Video Model project and making sure that it is in line with our vision.
soft_skills.justification: Managing project progress and ensuring alignment with vision shows ownership and responsibility.

soft_skills.phrase: Developing production quality software, our teams work "full stack" with the ability to deliver direct to product and impact the world.
soft_skills.justification: Working 'full stack' and delivering to product implies a broad scope of responsibility and ownership over the development process.

soft_skills.phrase: Taking ownership of the full ML lifecycle from concept, development, testing, validation to deployment.
soft_skills.justification: Taking ownership of the entire ML lifecycle is a strong indicator of innovation and ownership.

soft_skills.phrase: Adapting off-the-shelf solutions for the purposes of our product.
soft_skills.justification: This implies a proactive approach to problem-solving and adapting existing tools, which aligns with innovation and ownership.

soft_skills.phrase: Optimising for deployment - turning prototypes into working solutions.
soft_skills.justification: Optimizing for deployment and turning prototypes into solutions shows a pragmatic and results-oriented approach, fitting under innovation and ownership.

profile.rationale: The role involves a significant amount of core software engineering tasks (developing production quality software, building libraries, full ML lifecycle ownership, optimizing for deployment) which fall under Macro-Category A. Simultaneously, it heavily emphasizes Generative AI specialization tasks such as developing foundational models for video generation, conducting cutting-edge research in text-to-video synthesis, reviewing literature in the domain, and adapting off-the-shelf GenAI solutions. The mention of specific GenAI models like DALL.E, MUSE, IMAGEN, MAKE-A-VIDEO, and STABLE DIFFUSION clearly places the specialization within the Generative AI domain. This balance of strong software engineering practices with deep Generative AI specialization aligns with the 'Core GenAI Engineer' profile.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear about the responsibilities, explicitly mentioning both software development practices and specific Generative AI research and development tasks. The examples of technologies and the nature of the work leave little room for ambiguity in classifying the role.
